content: chore: adaptations for nightly-2025-04-04 #23794 Please review this PR. At the end of the month this diff will land in 'master'.
reminds me of the famous urban legend about knowing which screw to turn

My favorite version of that story is one about my old boss

Tom Knight and the Lisp Machine
A novice was trying to fix a broken Lisp machine by turning the power off and on.

Knight, seeing what the student was doing, spoke sternly: “You cannot fix a machine by just power-cycling it with no understanding of what is going wrong.”

Knight turned the machine off and on.

The machine worked.
Clearly, power-cycling it while understanding what is going wrong is the solution

Kevin Buzzard said:

5754 commits, +4 -3 :-)

The explanation here is that we don't want to reset nightly-testing, because that breaks various other branches forked off it. So it runs along "in parallel" to master, once a month coinciding, but having a hugely different history.
